author: The Canadian Press
title: Pierre Lafontaine new CEO of Canadian cross-country ski federation
text:
CANMORE, Alta. - Former swimming and university sport leader Pierre Lafontaine is the new chief executive officer of Canada's cross-country ski federation.
Lafontaine served as a national coach and CEO of Swimming Canada from 2005 to 2013 before moving to Canadian Interuniversity Sport as CEO for two years.

Pierre Lafontaine talks to reporters at the UBC Aquatic Centre in Vancouver, B.C., on Thursday May 24, 2012. Former swimming and university sport leader Lafontaine is the new chief executive officer of Canada's cross-country ski federation. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darryl Dyck 
The Beaconsfield, Que., native will take up his position at Cross Country Ski de Fond Canada on Dec. 1.
He will relocate from Ottawa to Canmore, Alta., where the national team in based at the Canmore Nordic Centre.
"There are many synergies between swimming and cross-country skiing," Lafontaine said Monday in a statement. "They are technically-driven sports that have athletes with great engines who are fiercely dedicated to achieving excellence."
The men's cross-country team has moved into the world's elite in recent years with Alex Harvey of Saint-Ferreol-les-Neiges, Que., and Devon Kershaw of Sudbury, Ont., winning World Cup and world championship medals.
Lafontaine said his short-term goal will be ensuring the skiers have everything they need for success at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea, in addition to plotting strategies for 2022 and beyond.
